refnamediv.refpurpose: Interface implemented by GtkRecentChooserWidget, GtkRecentChooserMenu and GtkRecentChooserDialog

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Known Implementations
refsect1.para: GtkRecentChooser is implemented by GtkRecentChooserDialog, GtkRecentChooserWidget and GtkRecentChooserMenu.

refsect1.title: Signals
refsect1.synopsis: item-activated : Run Last selection-changed : Run Last

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GtkRecentChooser is an interface that can be implemented by widgets displaying the list of recently used files. In GTK+, the main objects that implement this interface are GtkRecentChooserWidget, GtkRecentChooserDialog and GtkRecentChooserMenu.
Recently used files are supported since GTK+ 2.10.

refsect2.title: GtkRecentChooserIface
GTK_RECENT_CHOOSER_ERROR
refsect2.para: Used to get the GError quark for GtkRecentChooser errors.

refsect2.title: enum GtkRecentChooserError
refsect2.para: These identify the various errors that can occur while calling GtkRecentChooser functions.

listitem.simpara: Indicates that a file does not exist

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_set_show_private ()
refsect2.para: Whether to show recently used resources marked registered as private.

listitem.simpara: TRUE to show private items, FALSE otherwise

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_get_show_private ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether chooser should display recently used resources registered as private.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the recent chooser should show private items, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_set_show_not_found ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether chooser should display the recently used resources that it didn't find. This only applies to local resources.

listitem.simpara: whether to show the local items we didn't find

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_get_show_not_found ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves whether chooser should show the recently used resources that were not found.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the resources not found should be displayed, and FALSE otheriwse.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_set_show_icons ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether chooser should show an icon near the resource when displaying it.

listitem.simpara: whether to show an icon near the resource

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_get_show_icons ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves whether chooser should show an icon near the resource.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the icons should be displayed, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_set_select_multiple ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether chooser can select multiple items.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if chooser can select more than one item

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_get_select_multiple ()
refsect2.para: Gets whether chooser can select multiple items.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if chooser can select more than one item.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_set_local_only ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether only local resources, that is resources using the file:// URI scheme, should be shown in the recently used resources selector. If local_only is TRUE (the default) then the shown resources are guaranteed to be accessible through the operating system native file system.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if only local files can be shown

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_get_local_only ()
refsect2.para: Gets whether only local resources should be shown in the recently used resources selector. See gtk_recent_chooser_set_local_only()

listitem.simpara: TRUE if only local resources should be shown.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_set_limit ()
refsect2.para: Sets the number of items that should be returned by gtk_recent_chooser_get_items() and gtk_recent_chooser_get_uris().

listitem.simpara: a positive integer, or -1 for all items

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_get_limit ()
refsect2.para: Gets the number of items returned by gtk_recent_chooser_get_items() and gtk_recent_chooser_get_uris().

listitem.simpara: A positive integer, or -1 meaning that all items are returned.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_set_show_tips ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether to show a tooltips on the widget.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if tooltips should be shown

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_get_show_tips ()
refsect2.para: Gets whether chooser should display tooltips.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the recent chooser should show tooltips, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_set_show_numbers ()
refsect2.para: Whether to show recently used resources prepended by a unique number.
Do not use this function: use gtk_recent_chooser_menu_set_show_numbers() instead.

listitem.simpara: TRUE to show numbers, FALSE otherwise

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_get_show_numbers ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether chooser should display recently used resources prepended by a unique number.
Do not use this function: use gtk_recent_chooser_menu_get_show_numbers() instead.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the recent chooser should show display numbers, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: enum GtkRecentSortType
refsect2.para: Used to specify the sorting method to be applyed to the recently used resource list.

listitem.simpara: Do not sort the returned list of recently used resources.
Sort the returned list with the most recently used items first.
Sort the returned list with the least recently used items first.
Sort the returned list using a custom sorting function passed using gtk_recent_manager_set_sort_func().

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_set_sort_type ()
refsect2.para: Changes the sorting order of the recently used resources list displayed by chooser.

listitem.simpara: sort order that the chooser should use

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_get_sort_type ()
refsect2.para: Gets the value set by gtk_recent_chooser_set_sort_type().

listitem.simpara: the sorting order of the chooser.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_set_sort_func ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_recent_chooser_set_sort_func (GtkRecentChooser *chooser, GtkRecentSortFunc sort_func, gpointer sort_data, GDestroyNotify data_destroy);
refsect2.para: Sets the comparison function used when sorting to be sort_func. If the chooser has the sort type set to GTK_RECENT_SORT_CUSTOM then the chooser will sort using this function.

To the comparison function will be passed two GtkRecentInfo structs and sort_data; sort_func should return a positive integer if the first item comes before the second, zero if the two items are equal and a negative integer if the first item comes after the second.

listitem.simpara: user data to pass to sort_func, or NULL
destroy notifier for sort_data, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_set_current_uri ()
refsect2.para: Sets uri as the current URI for chooser.

listitem.simpara: return location for a GError, or NULL
TRUE if the URI was found.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_get_current_uri ()
refsect2.para: Gets the URI currently selected by chooser.

listitem.simpara: a newly allocated string holding a URI.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_get_current_item ()
refsect2.para: Gets the GtkRecentInfo currently selected by chooser.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentInfo. Use gtk_recent_info_unref() when when you have finished using it.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_select_uri ()
refsect2.para: Selects uri inside chooser.

listitem.simpara: return location for a GError, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_unselect_uri ()
refsect2.para: Unselects uri inside chooser.
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_select_all ()
refsect2.para: Selects all the items inside chooser, if the chooser supports multiple selection.
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_unselect_all ()
refsect2.para: Unselects all the items inside chooser.
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_get_items ()
refsect2.para: Gets the list of recently used resources in form of GtkRecentInfo objects.
The return value of this function is affected by the "sort-type" and "limit" properties of chooser.

listitem.simpara: A newly allocated list of GtkRecentInfo objects. You should use gtk_recent_info_unref() on every item of the list, and then free the list itself using g_list_free().

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_get_uris ()
refsect2.para: Gets the URI of the recently used resources.
The return value of this function is affected by the "sort-type" and "limit" properties of chooser.
Since the returned array is NULL terminated, length may be NULL.

listitem.simpara: return location for a the length of the URI list, or NULL
A newly allocated, NULL terminated array of strings. Use g_strfreev() to free it.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_add_filter ()
refsect2.para: Adds filter to the list of GtkRecentFilter objects held by chooser.
If no previous filter objects were defined, this function will call gtk_recent_chooser_set_filter().
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_remove_filter ()
refsect2.para: Removes filter from the list of GtkRecentFilter objects held by chooser.
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_list_filters ()
refsect2.para: Gets the GtkRecentFilter objects held by chooser.

listitem.simpara: A singly linked list of GtkRecentFilter objects. You should just free the returned list using g_slist_free().

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_set_filter ()
refsect2.para: Sets filter as the current GtkRecentFilter object used by chooser to affect the displayed recently used resources.
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_chooser_get_filter ()
refsect2.para: Gets the GtkRecentFilter object currently used by chooser to affect the display of the recently used resources.
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: The ::item-activated signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkRecentChooser *chooser, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: This signal is emitted when the user "activates" a recent item in the recent chooser. This can happen by double-clicking on an item in the recently used resources list, or by pressing Enter.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: The ::selection-changed signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkRecentChooser *chooser, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: This signal is emitted when there is a change in the set of selected recently used resources. This can happen when a user modifies the selection with the mouse or the keyboard, or when explicitely calling functions to change the selection.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10
